title: How to Keep Artemisias in Good Shape

steps.headline: Snip off the flowers when they appear.
steps.description: This will allow the energy to remain concentrated in maintaining top quality foliage. Artemesias are best pruned in early spring for the best bushy results during the growing season. Wait until there is certainty of no more frosts.

steps.headline: Cut back shoots as they appear early in the season.
steps.description: There will be occasional shoots appearing across the bush and it is best to cut these back lightly to avoid any crowding and to avoid having to cut the bush back severely later to thin it out. About 2.5 - 5cm/1-2 inches cutting back is fine. For older plants, cut back up to half of the bush.

steps.headline: Remove dead or diseased stems at all times.
steps.description: Always dispose of properly so as not to spread plant diseases.
